BR_text.BRsummary: DeprecationWarning: invalid escape sequence \c when using nearest_neighbors.create
BR_text.BRdescription:
When using turicreate.nearest_neighbors.create a warning appears.
 <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7233812/43851759-73e032c2-9af0-11e8-8971-5922a208583c.png></denchmark-link>

comments_0.comment_text:
I've seen this warning before and I don't believe it's anything to worry about. However we should investigate and hopefully stop what is causing the warning.
 I believe this is a Python 3 only issue. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/Digital-Rabbit>@Digital-Rabbit</denchmark-link>
  - what version of Python you are using?

comments_2.comment_text:
Looks like this is due to <denchmark-link:https://bugs.python.org/issue27364>https://bugs.python.org/issue27364</denchmark-link>
 . I'm guessing we need to update our code to either explicitly double-escape with , or use  for "raw" strings.
